records.location_details: Migrants were apprehended by Albanian authorities, transported to a centre in Albania, then allegedly brought to an abandoned area 40-50 minutes driving distance from the detention centre and dropped off on a path to the Greek-Albanian border, coerced to cross into Greece.

possible_violations.legal_basis: Art. 4 of Protocol no. 4 of the European Convention on Human Rights

possible_violations.violation_name: prohibition of inhuman or degrading treatment
possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 3 of the European Convention on Human Rights

records.context_note: Interviewed migrants claimed to have been apprehended by Albanian authorities, transported to a centre, not registered, then brought to an abandoned area near the Greek-Albanian border and coerced to cross into Greece. The Fundamental Rights Office could not assess the veracity of these allegations for this specific SIR but noted consistency with similar accounts in other SIRs.
records.evidence_quote: Albanian authorities allegedly brought them in a police car to an abandoned area, 40-50 minutes driving distance from the detention centre. They were dropped off on a path to the Greek-Albanian border and, wielding batons, Albanian reportedly authorities coerced them to cross the border to Greece.
